data.instruction: Write an SQL query given a natural language statement. You are given 3 tables : (1) Items(sku, description, storeid, supplierid, avg_rating, qty_per_day) (2) Suppliers(supplierid, name, location, diversity, preapproved) (3) Stores(storeid, location) (4) CompanyInfo(compid, name, description, type, rating, women_owned, minority_owned, Ssi, Ser, zip)

examples.input: What are the details for item with SKU="1234"
examples.output:
select Items.description, Items.avg_rating, Suppliers.name, Items.storeid, Stores.location
from Items, Stores, Suppliers
where Stores.storeid=Items.storeid and Suppliers.supplierid=Items.supplierid and Items.sku="1234"

examples.input: Top minority owned suppliers with ser and sis < 3 for area 123445 and item "green salad"
examples.output:
select name
from CompanyInfo
where ser < 3 and ssi < 3 and minority_owned=true and zip like "%123445%" and description like "%green salad%"
order by rating desc
